quest.name: A Void at All Costs
journal: Cid is eager to tackle the Deltascape's final test subject.

Ahead of your battle with Subject Delta IV, Nero furnishes you with some much-needed intelligence. Your opponent is a being known as Exdeath, who commands the power of the void. Like Halicarnassus before him, he is apparently the defeated antagonist of an age-old folktale. It is at this moment that Cid finally gives voice to his earlier quandary: why did Omega choose the vanquished instead of the vanquishers? Before you can contemplate the question, Cid receives a call from Biggs and Wedge, who report that they have been unable to repair the stasis system. And so it is decided that you must continue with Omega's experiment, at least for the time being. As always, Alpha is ready to proceed when you are.

※In the event that you leave the Interdimensional Rift, you may re-enter by speaking with the Ironworks hand at the Yawn.

In but three kwehs, Alpha expresses his determination to settle matters in the Deltascape. Fixing your gaze upon the nearby portal, you gird yourself for the coming trial.

※Deltascape V4.0 can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

Exdeath proves to be a fearsome foe, but following in the footsteps of the tale's heroes, you succeed in vanquishing him. In the wake of the battle, your comrades join you in the Deltascape, which is the Deltascape no more, having been summarily shut down by Omega, its purpose served. After congratulating you on your victory, your host bids you rest while you await the next call, and you are glad of the opportunity to leave the rift behind.
You find yourself back on the surface at the Yawn, your companions gathered nearby.

Cid thanks you for the pivotal role you have played in advancing the investigation. Though there are many and more battles to come, you have taken a momentous step towards solving the mystery that is Omega, and may now enjoy some well-earned respite.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kw...kwibbit?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: So that was Halicarnassus. I must congratulate Omega on her appearance. She looked exactly as I imagined her.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Though, if I were to pick fault, it did take certain liberties with her character. The queen of the tale was rather more restrained.

dialogue.name: GARLONDGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: Good eveningmorrowday to you, madamsir. Will you be descending into the Yawn?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Enter the Interdimensional Rift?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: The next battle is with Subject Delta IV─this test world's final resident.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: From what I have been able to gather, your opponent is, and I quote, “a great tree born of an agglomeration of evil will, which assumes the form of a dark mage.” All of which I suggest you ignore.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: His name is Exdeath, and he plays the role of chief antagonist in another ancient tale.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Though I was unable to glean the specifics of his abilities, he appears to command the power of the void─as indeed the story states.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: When I first encountered the work, I naturally assumed said power to be a metaphor of sorts. But I am quite sure Omega will have interpreted it as something more tangible.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Alas, no amount of analysis can tell us what may happen when Exdeath calls upon the power of the void. Which is to say: beware.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Tell me something, Nero. What happens at the end of the tale?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Why, good triumphs over evil and the heroes defeat Exdeath, of course. What did you expect?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I expected exactly that, which is precisely what troubled me earlier. If the heroes won, why did Omega not make them its test subjects?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: If it seeks to determine the strongest being, why would it bother with those who were defeated?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: One moment─linkpearl. ...Ah, Biggs. At the control room, are you? What news?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...I see. Very well. I'll tell the others. You two take care over there.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Sorry for the interruption. That was Biggs.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: He reports that the stasis system shows every sign of being engaged, despite the fact that it clearly isn't.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It can only be a malfunction. While we were able to turn it off, it would seem the reverse is not possible.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: The system may have taken damage during the Calamity. Does it look like it can be repaired?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Hard to say. They tell me it seems complex even by Allagan standards. While they may be able to fix it, there's no telling how long it might take.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Well then, we must keep on fighting the good fight here, must we not?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Nero has the right of it. At this time, focusing on Exdeath would seem to be our only recourse.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: The chocobo certainly has no objections. Come then, I would see you follow in the footsteps of the heroes of the tale!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: The void... 'Tis not unlike the nothingness that Emperor Xande sought in the Crystal Tower.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: To desire nothingness is to deny life, yet life seeks to endure─to perpetuate itself. It is the nature of all creation. Be it reality or fantasy, man shall ever fight to survive.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Biggs and Wedge had a further message for you. They said they were sorry they couldn't resolve things at their end, and wished you luck in the coming battle. I do too, old friend─unless I'm mistaken, this is like to be the toughest test yet.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: According to the tale, when the power of the void is finally unleashed, the laws of the universe will give way to chaos. I for one am eager to find out what that looks like.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh, kweh! Kweeeh!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alpha is the picture of resolve. You may enter Deltascape V4.0 whenever you are ready.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh, kweh! Kweeeh!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Forename! Thank the gods you're safe! When the shell around this place began to crack, we feared the worst!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Given that all of us are present and corporeal, does this mean this area is no longer the Deltascape?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <beep> Deltascape shutdown complete. Alpha group is victorious. Congratulations.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Your combat record has been archived for future matchmaking.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Results from other test worlds are still pending. In the meantime, please tend to your hurts and await further instructions. <blip>

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And with that, we've taken a significant step towards solving the mystery that is Omega. It hasn't been easy, but all in all, I'd say things were proceeding rather smoothly.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We couldn't have done it without you, old friend. Come, let us return to reality and enjoy what rest we can.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Things are proceeding smoothly indeed. Too smoothly...

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: 'Tis well that thou harborest doubts, mortal, but they are misplaced.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: Omega could have conducted its tests in complete secrecy, unbeknown to all.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: Yet not only did it betray its presence to you; it allowed you to come this far.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: Alpha. What art thou, truly?

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: The instrument of the mortals' triumph? Or the bait that lureth them unto the abyss?

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: Hm. Thou knowest not thine own purpose. Then we can but watch and wait.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Outcome unexpected. Projections gave Delta subjects the upper hand.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Outcome supports hypothesis. As previously observed, certain beings may unleash hidden potential when subjected to stress.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Initiating new test: subject Alpha group members to severe stress. Searching database for suitable event...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <bloop> Event found: the death of a comrade.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: For all Garlond's whining, I was cooperative and helpful, was I not? I look forward to many more such forays together, hero.

dialogue.name: GARLONDGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: Good to have you back, madamsir! Worry not─I shall see to it that no one falls in.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Ahhh, it feels good to be back on solid ground. Thank you again, old friend.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You did well too, Alpha, fearlessly going into battle whenever you were called upon. We're glad to have you with us. Speaking of which, are you...comfortable joining us out here?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I'll take that as a yes. Well then, at the risk of obeying Omega's orders, I suggest we permit ourselves a moment's respite─ Ah. But mayhap I should take this opportunity to compile the results of our investigation thus far. No rest for the righteous...
